concise_definition: v. 爬行, 缓慢移动; n. 爬行

definitions.explanation_en: To move slowly on hands and knees or with the body close to the ground, typically used by infants, animals, or people in confined spaces.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指用手和膝盖或身体贴近地面缓慢移动，常用于婴儿、动物或在狭小空间中的人。
definitions.example_en: The baby is just learning to crawl across the floor.
definitions.example_cn: 这个婴儿正在学习如何在地板上爬行。

definitions.explanation_en: To move or progress very slowly, often due to difficulty, congestion, or lack of speed.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指因困难、拥堵或速度缓慢而极其缓慢地前进或进展。
definitions.example_en: Traffic was crawling along the highway during the rush hour.
definitions.example_cn: 高峰时段，车流在高速公路上缓慢前行。

definitions.explanation_en: To move stealthily or cautiously, often with the intent to avoid detection.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指小心翼翼、偷偷地移动，通常是为了避免被发现。
definitions.example_en: The spy crawled through the bushes to get closer to the building.
definitions.example_cn: 间谍悄悄地穿过灌木丛，靠近那栋大楼。

definitions.explanation_en: The act of moving slowly on hands and knees or close to the ground.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指用手和膝盖或贴近地面缓慢移动的行为。
definitions.example_en: The puppy's crawl across the carpet was adorable.
definitions.example_cn: 小狗在地毯上爬行的样子非常可爱。

comparison.analysis: “Creep” (悄悄移动) 与 “crawl” 非常相似，但更强调隐蔽、无声和令人不安的缓慢移动，常带有负面或神秘的语义色彩。例如，阴影在墙上 creeping。而 “crawl” 更中性，可指婴儿或动物的正常动作，不一定隐含秘密性。
“Shuffle” (拖着脚走) 指脚不离地、缓慢而无精打采地移动，通常用于描述人走路的姿态，如老人或疲惫者。它不涉及身体贴近地面，而 “crawl” 必须是四肢或身体贴近地面的移动方式。
“Scuttle” (急促爬行) 指快速、短促、多为侧向的爬行，常用于描述螃蟹或老鼠等动物。它强调速度和方向的突然性，而 “crawl” 通常是缓慢、稳定、向前的移动。
